summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Anjan Sahni and defense attorney Allison Stoddart regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. They are scheduling a call to discuss identifying an appropriate witness from JP Morgan and sharing draft exhibits.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, coordinating with prosecutors about witness identification and exhibits.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York handling the Ghislaine Maxwell case, initiating contact about witness identification from JP Morgan.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, referenced in the email subject and context.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about case logistics, witness identification, and evidence sharing in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.
Prosecutor handling the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Defense attorney involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, likely part of her legal team.

events.title: Email coordination for witness discussion
events.description: Prosecutors and defense attorneys schedule a call to discuss identifying an appropriate witness from JP Morgan and review draft exhibits in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: Prosecutors are seeking to identify an appropriate witness from JP Morgan in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Draft exhibits are being shared between prosecution and defense to facilitate discussions about the witness.
The email correspondence shows ongoing pretrial coordination and evidence exchange in October 2021.
The case is identified as United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
